cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest then north, making landfall along the Florida Big-Bend, then cross the peninsula and accelerate northeastward just offshore the GA/SC coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected from the Florida Big Bend through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas; east-central Florida including Canaveral could see peripheral rainbands and gusty winds
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – 3-5 inches possible with isolated higher pockets in rainbands
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No – surge threat focuses on Gulf side, not east-central Florida
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Thu as the center crosses north of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 3–5 inches, producing localized ponding and minor flooding on port property
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning mid-week as the cyclone moves into the Atlantic
